message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS. 

The paper deals with community-based question answering (CQA) websites, which involves natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) techniques. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also proposes an adversarial training framework, which involves machine learning and optimization techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category as well. Additionally, the paper employs a generative model and multi-scale matching, which are related to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), respectively.
